name: Scaramouche
desc: The former sixth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, created by Raiden Ei.

customize.text: Known Names

Kabukimono
"Kabukimono" referred mostly to those who wore vibrant colors and behaved in a peculiar manner. The puppet was called Kabukimono by the Tatarasuna workers.
Kunikuzushi
In Inazuma's traditional theater, there is a certain character known as "Kunikuzushi." Such characters are often schemers and usurpers of nations. Kabukimono chose this name at the end of his wandering.
Scaramouche
The Balladeer
The puppet's name when he joined the

customize.name: Fatui
customize.desc: A Snezhnayan organization that is loyal to the Tsaritsa and has spread out all over the continent. Its Harbingers are on the hunt for the Gnoses.

customize.text:
and became the sixth of the Fatui Harbingers.
Wanderer
Scaramouche became the Wanderer after he erased himself from

customize.name: Irminsul
customize.desc: Irminsul can be thought of as a large tree growing downwards rather than upwards, containing all the knowledge and wisdom of the world from ancient times to the present. Ley Lines, like the roots of Irminsul, cross the earth, absorbing the memories of the world.

customize.text: Relationships

customize.name: Beelzebul
customize.desc: The Electro Archon of Inazuma, known as Raiden Ei.

customize.text:
Raiden Ei created Scaramouche as a prototype puppet to prove the concept of creating a puppet body.
Katsuragi
Niwa
Mikoshi Nagamasa
Miyazaki
The people from Tatarasuna who found the puppet and became his family.

customize.name: Yae Miko
customize.desc: Lady Guuji of the Grand Narukami Shrine. Also serves as the editor-in-chief of Yae Publishing House. Unimaginable intelligence and cunning are hidden under her beautiful appearance.

customize.text:
When Kabukimono asked for help for Tatarasuna, Yae Miko sent people to their aid immediately, but he was convinced that the Shogunate had forsaken Tatarasuna. When he left Tatarasuna after Niwa's death, she didn't want to further disturb him and merely sent someone to return the feather to him.
When The Balladeer threatened the Traveler's life, Yae Miko exchanged the life for the Electro

customize.name: Gnosis
customize.desc: Gnoses are internal magical foci that each of The Seven possesses, allowing them to resonate directly with Celestia itself and serving as an emblem of their status. The Gnoses were created from the remains of the Third Descender.

customize.name: Fatui
customize.desc: A Snezhnayan organization that is loyal to the Tsaritsa and has spread out all over the continent. Its Harbingers are on the hunt for the Gnoses.

customize.text: A few years after three betrayals and leaving Tatarasuna, the puppet joined the Fatui and became the sixth Fatui Harbinger.

customize.name: Il Dottore
customize.desc: The Second of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, codenamed The Doctor. Had multiple "segments" of himself, nearly all of which he destroyed in a deal with the Dendro Archon.

customize.text: The Fatui Harbinger who tested on Scaramouche to find a technology to create the "segments" of himself. He unlocked the seal on Scaramouche's body, causing his abilities to increase greatly, and later tried to turn the Balladeer into a new Archon.

customize.name: Shouki no Kami, the Prodigal
customize.desc:
Shouki no Kami, as an artificial divinity created using all the might of Sumeru's Six Darshans, has power that rivals that of true gods.
But those of this world who call such a being a "false deity" misunderstand the true meaning of the word.
Shouki no Kami now understands countless things and shoulders unassailable might, and may be said to surpass mortals.
If gods must love mortals, then Shouki no Kami, who grants failure in equal measure to humanity loves them also.
If gods must watch over humanity,
...
...
Then Shouki no Kami who has borne witness to infinite love, hatred, partings, grudges, and maddening anger - thus does he watch over mortals.

"Too much happiness you have had!"
"It has made you foolish. Arrogant. Horrifying in your greed."
"Let this era end!"
"Let the new god announce the defeat of the old."
"Foolish mortal... There is yet time for you to kneel."

customize.text: A mechanical body for a new Archon created by the

customize.name: Sumeru Akademiya
customize.desc: The Sumeru organization, which exercises administrative control over the region and educates people.

customize.text: The God of Wisdom defeated Scaramouche and took the Electro Gnosis away.

customize.name: Wanderer
customize.desc: A wayfaring figure whose identity is a mystery. He dresses like a mountain ascetic, but he certainly does not act the part.

customize.text: Scaramouche's new personality after he erased himself from Irminsul. He's currently studying at the Sumeru Akademiya, Vahumana Darshan.

customize.name: Mona
customize.desc: A mysterious young astrologer who proclaims herself to be "Astrologist Mona Megistus," and who possesses abilities to match the title. Erudite, but prideful.

customize.name: Fischl
customize.desc: A mysterious girl who calls herself "Prinzessin der Verurteilung" and travels with a night raven named Oz.

customize.text: Scaramouche met with the Traveler, Mona, and Fischl on his expedition to study the fallen stars. With her abilities, Mona realized the danger of the Harbinger and teleported them away.
Related Books and Items

customize.name: Ancient Forging Blueprint
customize.desc:
An ancient forging blueprint. The Shogun once ordered the Kaedehara Clan to forge a Goshintou according to it.
After being soaked in water, it becomes clear that some of the text has been blurred — someone tampered with the blueprint, dooming the forging to failure and triggering the tragedy that followed...

customize.name: Raiden Shogun
customize.desc: Her Excellency, the Almighty Narukami Ogosho, who promised the people of Inazuma an unchanging Eternity.

customize.text: Voice-Overs

<color=#ffd780>About Kunikuzushi</color>
<color=#ffffff73>He came about as a byproduct of creating the Shogun. Perhaps it's because I feel like I owe him something, but I do not wish to assert control over him.</color>
Character Story

<color=#ffd780>Character Story 2</color>
<color=#ffffff73>For beings with a perishable form of flesh to pursue Eternity, they must first solve the unavoidable problem of lifespan.</color>
<color=#ffffff73>This limited time troubled Ei greatly, until one day when a mysterious technique came before her eyes as if by a stroke of fate.</color>
<color=#ffffff73>Using such techniques, one could create intricate puppets indistinguishable from true life.</color>
<color=#ffffff73>In theory, this puppet could perfectly imitate everything about Ei. It could surpass the limits of her lifespan and defend Inazuma forever. Yet, how could creating a copy of an Archon be a simple affair?</color>
<color=#ffffff73>Ei conducted countless experiments to this effect, discarded a great many failed products, and spent an unimaginable amount of time and resources—</color>
<color=#ffffff73>But at last, by her dogged pursuit and warrior's spirit, she was able to create a flawless puppet.</color>
<color=#ffffff73>The newborn Raiden Shogun sat there silently, listening to Ei speak all about her, "her," and even about them. The future of Inazuma was here, inscribed upon a gorgeous blueprint.</color>
<color=#ffffff73>The automaton had but one question to ask Ei: "There is no turning back from forsaking your form. Do you regret nothing?"</color>
<color=#ffffff73>"Your existence is my answer."</color>
<color=#ffffff73>Then, Ei transferred her consciousness into her blade, and thus was born the Plane of Euthymia.</color>

customize.name: Yae Miko
customize.desc: Lady Guuji of the Grand Narukami Shrine. Also serves as the editor-in-chief of Yae Publishing House. Unimaginable intelligence and cunning are hidden under her beautiful appearance.

customize.text: Voice-Overs

<color=#ffd780>About Kunikuzushi</color>
<color=#ffffff73>I thought it was a disaster waiting to happen at the time, but she insisted that she wasn't going to lift a finger against the object of her own creation. Had I known how things would unfold, I would have simply disposed of it without her knowing. Hmm? What about now? Hehe... Well, we're no longer waiting for the disaster to happen, are we?</color>
Dialogues

<color=#ffd780>About the puppet</color>
<color=#ffffff73>That puppet was built with technology that has been lost to time. Perhaps she, as a god, is the only one privy to the knowledge of its origins...</color>
<color=#ffffff73>Before Ei began modifying her own godly form, she took it upon herself to create a prototype puppet...</color>
<color=#ffffff73>No, the prototype was merely a proof of concept. Its appearance and intellect were not based on Ei. It was a test.</color>
<color=#ffffff73>The original plan was for Ei to simply discard it. But perhaps Ei thought this to be too cruel, because in the end she chose only to seal the power within it.</color>
<color=#ffffff73>Later, this puppet wandered Inazuma as an ordinary human male with his own consciousness, until... the Fatui took an interest in him.</color>
<color=#ffffff73>Some eccentric geniuses in the ranks of the Fatui made adjustments to the prototype, not only unsealing his power, but very likely rendering him even more formidable than his original specifications.</color>
<color=#ffffff73>Mm-hmm. The object of divine creation is the one who has now taken possession of the Gnosis... and the prototype puppet is now known as "The Balladeer."</color>

customize.name: Tartaglia
customize.desc: No. 11 of The Harbingers, also known as "Childe." His name is highly feared on the battlefield.

customize.text: Voice-Overs

<color=#ffd780>About The Balladeer</color>
<color=#ffffff73>After he took the Gnosis, we lost all contact with him. Now comes the task of trying to hunt it down and get it back... I actually don't mind it — it means I get to travel all over. Wonder if I'll run into you somewhere along the way?</color>

customize.name: Nahida
customize.desc: A caged bird secluded within the confines of the Sanctuary of Surasthana who can only see the world in her dreams.

customize.text: Voice-Overs

<color=#ffd780>About The Balladeer</color>
<color=#ffffff73>When he finally achieved the ambition he thought he'd been pursuing all along, was he content at last, or only emptier still? We only yearn for the skies because we cannot fly... Hmm, perhaps he should reflect on this once he has held the sheer emptiness of the skies in his grasp.</color>
